intro: Spermacoce gracilis, commonly known as slender false mignonette, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Spermacoce gracilis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
